medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began 12 hours prior to presentation after dinner at 1800. Initially felt pain and discomfort throughout the abdomen, which has progressed to dull, constant, periumbilical pain that is nonradiating and nonpositional. Patient reports subjective fevers and chills as well as non-bilious, non-bloody emesis. Currently nauseous in the emergency department. No previous episodes of similar symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hydrocephalus as a child, status post VP shunt placement; VP shunt not functional for several years.
